Cubic can be installed on distributions based on:
- Ubuntu 18.04.5 Bionic Beaver and above
- Debian 11 Bullseye and above

### <img src="https://github.com/PJ-Singh-001/Cubic/blob/release/screenshots/ubuntu-logo.png" height="48"/> Ubuntu and Derivatives

Install Cubic using the following commands:

    sudo apt-add-repository universe
    sudo apt-add-repository ppa:cubic-wizard/release
    sudo apt update
    sudo apt install --no-install-recommends cubic

Note: The `--no-install-recommends` option should be used to prevent the packages that Cubic depends on from installing additional unnecessary software.

On some systems you may first need to manually add the repository key for Cubic:

    sudo apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys B7579F80E494ED3406A59DF9081525E2B4F1283B

### <img src="https://github.com/PJ-Singh-001/Cubic/blob/release/screenshots/debian-logo.png" height="32"/> Debian and Derivatives

Install `dpkg` version 1.21 or higher. Note that Debian `bookworm` already includes `dpkg` version 1.21.20. 

If you are running Debian `bullseye`, you can temporarily use the `bookworm` repositories to install `dpkg` version 1.21.20 and its required (newer) dependencies. _However, be careful with this hack, as this may break your system._

    cd /etc/apt
    cp sources.list sources.list.original
    sed -i "s|bullseye|bookworm|g" sources.list
    apt update

    apt install dpkg

    cp sources.list.original sources.list
    apt update

(Remember to use `sudo` for the above commands, if you are not `root`).

Once you have `dpkg` version 1.21 or higher, install Cubic.

    echo "deb https://ppa.launchpadcontent.net/cubic-wizard/release/ubuntu/ jammy main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cubic-wizard-release.list
    sudo curl -S "https://keyserver.ubuntu.com/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0x081525e2b4f1283b" | sudo gpg --batch --yes --dearmor --output /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/cubic-wizard-ubuntu-release.gpg
    apt update
    apt install cubic

(Remember to use `sudo` for the `tee` and `apt` commands, if you are not `root`).
